title: Eugerres plumieri
text: The striped mojarra ("Eugerres plumieri") is a <a href="demersal">demersal</a> fish found in the western Atlantic, from <a href="North%20Carolina">North Carolina</a> south along the U.S. coast, in the <a href="Gulf%20of%20Mexico">Gulf of Mexico</a>, in the Caribbean from Cuba to Puerto Rico, and along the Central and South American coast from Mexico to Colombia. It inhabits shallow coastal waters with low salinity in mangrove-lined creeks and lagoons. It feeds on aquatic insects, crustaceans, micro-bivalves and <a href="detritus">detritus</a>. This species has high <a href="fecundity">fecundity</a>, producing 85,345 to 953,870 eggs, and reaches a length of 40 cm. It is abundant in Mexico and Colombia, where it is one of the most important fishing resources, both as food and fishing bait.
